thread.title: Manchester United stars look like they have little worries about fixture pile-up as they relax in jacuzzi
thread.title_full: Manchester United stars look like they have little worries about fixture pile-up as they relax in jacuzzi

author: rforrester
title: Manchester United stars look like they have little worries about fixture pile-up as they relax in jacuzzi
text:
In hot water Manchester United stars look like they have little worries about fixture pile-up as they relax in jacuzzi 
Red Devils travel to Middlesbrough on Sunday for their third fixture inside a week - much to the annoyance of Jose Mourinho Pictured 17th March 2017, 11:38 pm Updated: 18th March 2017, 1:32 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MANCHESTER UNITED stars may be feeling fatigue from a hectic fixture pile-up but they found time to relax in the jacuzzi. 
The Red Devils are preparing for their third fixture in just six days when they travel to Middlesbrough on Sunday. A post shared by Eric Bailly (@ericbailly24) on Mar 17, 2017 at 9:38am PDT 
Furious United boss Jose Mourinho has hit out at the football authorities just a day after knocking Rostov out of the Europa League by claiming they don’t give ‘S’about English teams in Europe. 
Keep up to date with ALL the MANCHESTER UNITED news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But the likes of Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Juan Mata looked like they had little care in the world as they found time to unwind in the pool. 
Joined by Marcos Rojo and Eric Bailly, the latter took to Instagram to share a snap of the quartet alongside the caption: “Recovery day with these aquatic creatures.” 
Mata scored the all-important goal that sealed United’s qualification into the quarter-finals of the Europa League and book a tie with Belgian side Anderlecht. Reuters Jose Mourinho hit out at Manchester United’s hectic fixture schedule most read Pog cash hog Manchester United's £89m star Paul Pogba has taken THREE months to pay £100 bill to a removal man preview Bournemouth vs Swansea: What time does it kick off, what TV channel is it on and the latest team news from the Premier League game Preview When is Stoke vs Chelsea, what TV channel is it on and what is latest team news? Preview When is Sunderland vs Burnley, what TV channel is it on and what is latest team news? Preview When is West Ham vs Leicester, what TV channel is it on and what is latest team news? PREVIEW When is Everton vs Hull, what TV channel is it on and what is latest team news? Preview When is West Brom vs Arsenal, what TV channel is it on and what is latest team news? team news Bournemouth vs Swansea team news: Swans hoping star striker Fernando Llorente is fit for Cherries clash TEAM NEWS When is Sunderland vs Burnley team news, when is it and what TV channel is it on? team news West Ham vs Leicester team news: Hammers captain Mark Noble could be dropped for poor form Preview Chelsea sweat on the fitness of wing-back Victor Moses for Prem clash against Stoke TEAM NEWS Hull vs Everton team news: Romelu Lukaku set to start despite refusing to sign new contract EPA 2 Paul Pogba has vowed to come back stronger after his latest injury 
But their attentions will turn to struggling Boro on Sunday as Mourinho is set to be without Paul Pogba and Daley Blind. 
Pogba came off injured at half-time with a hamstring problem against Rostov but took to Twitter to claim he will come back stronger. 
Wayne Rooney and Anthony Martial are also likely to be sidelined. Sunday Premier League match preview featuring Man City v Liverpool
